Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: மடியிலா மன்னவன் எய்தும் அடியளந்தான் தாஅய தெல்லாம் ஒருங்கு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The king who never gives way to idleness will obtain entire possession of (the whole earth) measured by the foot (of Vishnu).

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A king who is free from idleness ('மடியிலா மன்னவன்') is depicted as a figure of immense energy and constant motion. He is not seated, but actively striding across his lands.
Layered_Composition.Midground: As he strides forward, the entire world, visualized as a vast map, unfurls before him. His single footstep covers entire continents, in a direct visual echo of the great Trivikrama avatar of Vishnu who measured the world ('அடியளந்தான்').
Layered_Composition.Background: The king is shown effortlessly gaining dominion over the entire world ('தாஅய தெல்லாம் ஒருங்கு') as a direct result of his tireless energy.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The king who is free from laziness will conquer and possess the entire world, just as Vishnu once measured it all in a single step.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The king's stride mirroring the mythical stride of Vishnu's avatar is the central, epic metaphor. The world map unfurling before him represents his easy conquest.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A brilliant, cosmic, and divine light illuminates the king. His footsteps leave a trail of golden energy. The palette is grand and mythological.

Technical_Cues.Camera: An ultra-wide, epic low-angle shot that captures the immense scale of the king's stride and his dominion over the world.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, cinematic, with mythical and cosmic visual effects.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: God rays and divine, radiant lighting.
